message:
SA ,
i was installing ruby and rails frame work but when i generate controller in cmd it out the error 
(←[31mCould not find gem 'sdoc (>= 0) x86-mingw32' in the gems available on this
machine.←[0m
←[33mRun `bundle install` to install missing gems.←[0m
)
and when i install bundle it out the error too 
(error: while executing gem ... <argument error> unknown encoding name - cp720
)
can anyone have a solution !?

data.message: Emad Elsaid
https://groups.google.com/forum/#!msg/rubyinstaller/E4pb4Scw5SU/fBu9CpUyFR8J
جرب كده تشيل السطر بتاعالجيم ديمن gemfile اعمل للسطر اللي فيه sdoc كومنت و جرب كده
you are installing it on mac, linux or windows?
اعتقد ويندوز لان الكوماند لاين بتاعه مش بيحول الاكواد لالوان فابيطلع حاجات زي [31 و الاسهم و الكلام ده

For anyone to properly help here, we need three things...

- Your Gemfile (Use http://pastie.org)

- What kind of platform are you on (this is clearly a windows running a MinGw chain, but I need to know what windows are we talking about)

- Your systems configuration, please answer these questions:
 -- how did you get ruby installed (did you use pik?), what version is your ruby?
 -- did you build it yourself? then what build configurations did you use?
 -- how did you get rails installed? 

Also you are saying, you were installing the Ruby on Rails framework and you are generating a controller, did you actually install Ruby on Rails?

Also how are you running your commands, using a "bundle exec"?

Edit: Also kindly http://pastie.org the entire terminal output.

this the first time to work on ruby on rails , so some thing may i missing 
-http://pastie.org/8725027 (if that the gem file that you talking about)
-i have window 8.1
-i install the ruby form the website (http://rubyonrails.org/download)
-i setup rails from this website (http://railsinstaller.org/en)
-i mean i installed ruby and framework rails 
- i read the command (gem install bundle) but out the error
- http://pastie.org/8725057
Emad Elsaid i didn't get what you talk about !

open: Gemfile -> this fiel will be found in the root of your project
comment the line that contain : sdoc
save
run: bundle install again
انا قرأت انك بتكتب gem install bundle اولا الgem نفسها اسمها bundler ثانيا هو يقصد انك تكتب bundle install بس عشان يعمل install للgems الناقصة

لو اللي كانت نقصاك bundler نفسها كنت ساعتها هتزلها ب gem install bundler بس هي اصلا هتكون موجوده عندك, لكن كل ما هتضيف gem جوا ال gem file هتنزلها بانك تكتب bundle install بس لكن لما كنت بتكتب gem install bundle كان بيظهرلك error لانه ميعرفش اللي انت كتبته

Emad Elsaid sorry , but the same error 
i want to install bitnami !?

Ebrahim Hamdy the gem file is named "Gemfile", kindly pastie this.
And pastie the output from "gem list"

Also this command "gem install bundle" should be "gem install bundler"

So you installed ruby using rubyinstaller for windows, which version? 1.8, 1.9 or 2.0

Edit Explanation to what's happening: In general, this error is sometimes related to a gem not being required for some reason. Might be a mess up from a 3rd-party gem or you're forcefully instructing rails not to require that gem during boot sequence.

I don't know what's included in your Gemfile, but if you have something like
> gem "sdoc", :require => false
or
> gem "sdoc", require: false

please remove the "require" part. then run "bundle install"

The gem looks something like this one:

source 'https://rubygems.org'

gem 'rails', '3.2.14'
gem 'mysql2', '0.3.13'
gem 'bcrypt-ruby', '~> 3.0.0'

group :development do
  gem 'quiet_assets', "1.0.2"
  gem "debugger", '1.6.2'
  gem 'letter_opener', "1.1.2"
end

group :staging, :production do
  gem 'unicorn', '4.6.3'
end
thank you the error solved , but i have a problem to connect to localhost:3000 !?
in your hosts file do you have mapping localhost 127.0.0.1 ?

that is the contains of host file 

# Copyright (c) 1993-2009 Microsoft Corp.
#
# This is a sample HOSTS file used by Microsoft TCP/IP for Windows.
#
# This file contains the mappings of IP addresses to host names. Each
# entry should be kept on an individual line. The IP address should
# be placed in the first column followed by the corresponding host name.
# The IP address and the host name should be separated by at least one
# space.
#
# Additionally, comments (such as these) may be inserted on individual
# lines or following the machine name denoted by a '#' symbol.
#
# For example:
#
#      102.54.94.97     rhino.acme.com          # source server
#       38.25.63.10     x.acme.com              # x client host

# localhost name resolution is handled within DNS itself.
# 127.0.0.1       localhost
# ::1             localhost
127.0.0.1 activate.adobe.com
127.0.0.1 practivate.adobe.com
127.0.0.1 lm.licenses.adobe.com
you need to uncomment # 127.0.0.1 localhost
done , but the problem to connect to 127.0.0.1:3000
try to write it as localhost:3000
